verses.verse: (Ps. 79:4; 80:6; Jer. 24:9) You make us a reproach to our neighbors, A scorn and a derision to those all around us.
(Deut. 28:37) You make us a byword among the nations, (Job 16:4) A shaking of the head among the peoples.
My dishonor is continually before me, And the shame of my face has covered me,
Because of the voice of him who reproaches and reviles, (Ps. 8:2) Because of the enemy and the avenger.
(Dan. 9:13) All this has come upon us; But we have not forgotten You, Nor have we dealt falsely with Your covenant.
Our heart has not turned back, (Job 23:11) Nor have our steps departed from Your way;
But You have severely broken us in (Is. 34:13) the place of jackals, And covered us ((Ps. 23:4)) with the shadow of death.
If we had forgotten the name of our God, Or ((Deut. 6:14)) stretched out our hands to a foreign god,
(Job 31:14; (Ps. 139:1, 2; Jer. 17:10)) Would not God search this out? For He knows the secrets of the heart.
(Rom. 8:36) Yet for Your sake we are killed all day long; We are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.
(Ps. 7:6) Awake! Why do You sleep, O Lord? Arise! Do not cast us off forever.
(Job 13:24) Why do You hide Your face, And forget our affliction and our oppression?
For (Ps. 119:25) our soul is bowed down to the dust; Our body clings to the ground.
Arise for our help, And redeem us for Your mercies’ sake.

(The Glories of the Messiah and His Bride) To the Chief Musician. (Ps. 69:title) Set to “The Lilies.” A Contemplation of the sons of Korah. A Song of Love. [1] My heart is overflowing with a good theme; I recite my composition concerning the King; My tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
You are fairer than the sons of men; (Luke 4:22) Grace is poured upon Your lips; Therefore God has blessed You forever.
Gird Your ((Is. 49:2; Heb. 4:12); Rev. 1:16) sword upon Your thigh, ((Is. 9:6)) O Mighty One, With Your (Jude 25) glory and Your majesty.
